intro: Sinapistrum pentaphyllum, commonly known as the five-leafed sinapistrum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with five leaflets. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
